MEDIAN_AGE: Median age has a positive effect on the number of crime
T_STAT: when null hypotesis considering 0 as coefficient, 1.82 = coef / std_err (8197.1697 / 4503.049)
P_VALUE:
p-value = proba that what you obeserved is just due to pure chance. 
0.128 means that 12.8% of the results is due to chance. So its not statistically significant at the 95% confidence level and same at 90% confidence level.
INCREASE: Holding all the other regressors constant, if the share of families with married couple increase 1%, the total number of incidents is likely to decrease 2115.1839 with 95% confidence
LIMITATIONS: lain limitation is, I think, the high correlation between the features.
